children.name: routeMissing
children.description: Triggered when the URL does not match any of the provided routes.

children.name: change
children.description: Triggered when the fragment part of the URL changes.

children.name: back
children.description: Triggered when the user navigates back to the previous URL.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Unbinds the router instance listeners from the URL fragment part changes.

children.name: replace

parameters.name: silent `Boolean` **(default: false)**
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the router callbacks will not be called.

children.description: Navigates to the given route, replacing the current view in the history stack (like `window.history.replaceState` or `location.replace` work).

parameters.name: silent `Boolean` **(default: false)**
parameters.description: If set to true, the router callbacks will not be called.

parameters.name: callback `Function`
parameters.description: The callback to be executed when the route is matched.

children.name: start
children.description: Activates the router binding to the URL changes.> The `start` method should only be called once the routes have been registered. Otherwise the route for the current page/fragment will not be called.

children.name: hashBang
children.description: Introduced in the 2014 Q1 Service Pack 1 release. If set to `true`, the hash based navigation will parse and prefix the fragment value with `!`,which [should be SEO friendly](http://googlewebmastercentral.blogspot.com/2009/10/proposal-for-making-ajax-crawlable.html), and allows non-prefixed anchor links to work as expected.

children.name: root
children.description: Applicable if `pushState` is used and the application is deployed to a path different than `/`. If the application start page is hosted on `http://foo.com/myapp/`, the root option should be set to `/myapp/`.

children.name: pushState
children.description: If set to true, the router will use the [history pushState API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/API/DOM/Manipulating_the_browser_history#The_pushState().C2.A0method).> The history pushState API currently has [limited support accross current browsers](http://caniuse.com/#search=pushstate).

children.name: ignoreCase
children.description: Introduced with Q3 2014. If set to `false`, the router instance will perform case sensitive match of the url against the defined routes.
